name: Catholic Health Association of the United States
description: The Catholic Health Association (CHA) is a national organization that advocates for Catholic healthcare providers and their mission to serve all communities, including those relying on Medicare and Medicaid programs. They work to strengthen Medicare and ensure access to care for vulnerable populations

name: Pennsylvania Catholic Health Association (PCHA)
description: The PCHA is a statewide organization representing the Catholic health ministry in Pennsylvania on public policy matters. They advocate for the interests of Catholic healthcare providers and the communities they serve

name: Catholic Charities of Philadelphia
description: Catholic Charities of Philadelphia provides a range of support services, including care for seniors, families, and individuals with disabilities across the Philadelphia region. While not a direct Medicare provider, they offer essential services that can complement Medicare benefits

name: Catholic Charities of Harrisburg, PA
description: This branch of Catholic Charities serves individuals and families in need throughout the Diocese of Harrisburg, offering compassionate assistance and support. They aim to help people facing life's challenges, which can include navigating healthcare needs

name: Catholic Charities - Southwestern PA
description: Catholic Charities in Southwestern Pennsylvania provides food, shelter, healthcare, and hope to thousands. Their mission is rooted in Catholic social teaching, focusing on connecting people to resources, healing minds and bodies, and empowering individuals and families

name: Catholic Charities - Western District of Pennsylvania
description: This Catholic Charities location offers basic needs assistance, professional counseling, and operates a Free Health Care Center. They provide services to individuals and families, including those needing help with utility bills, food, and disaster relief

name: Catholic Charities, Inc. (Diocese of Altoona-Johnstown)
description: This Catholic Charities agency serves Bedford, Blair, Cambria, Centre, Clinton, Fulton, Huntingdon, and Somerset counties. They provide compassionate care and emergency financial services to those without access to basic needs

name: MyCatholicDoctor.com (Pennsylvania Clinicians)
description: This platform lists Catholic clinicians in Pennsylvania who offer various medical services. While not a direct Medicare provider, it connects individuals with doctors who practice from a Catholic perspective and may accept Medicare

name: PA MEDI (Pennsylvania Medicare Education and Decision Insight)
description: PA MEDI is a statewide service operated by the Pennsylvania Department of Aging, providing free and confidential Medicare counseling through certified counselors. They offer unbiased help with Medicare plans, enrollment, billing, and financial assistance programs

name: Mercy Care Advantage (HMO SNP)
description: Mercy Care Advantage is a health maintenance organization special needs plan that provides Medicare benefits to individuals eligible for both Medicaid and Medicare. They focus on the needs of the whole person
